s-1.ptxt: DISCONNECT CABLE FROM NEGATIVE BATTERY TERMINAL

atten3.ptxt: When disconnecting the cable, some systems need to be initialized after the cable is reconnected (See page ).

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE FRONT WIPER ARM HEAD CAP

s2.ptxt: Using a screwdriver, remove the front wiper arm head cap.

item.ptxt: Tape the screwdriver tip before use.
Use the same procedure for both front wiper arm head caps.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE FRONT WIPER ARM AND BLADE ASSEMBLY LH

s2.ptxt: Remove the nut and the front wiper arm and blade assembly LH.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE FRONT WIPER ARM AND BLADE ASSEMBLY RH

s2.ptxt: Remove the nut and the front wiper arm and blade assembly RH.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE HOOD TO COWL TOP SEAL

s2.ptxt: Using a clip remover, detach the 9 clips and remove the hood to cowl top seal.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE COWL TOP VENTILATOR LOUVER RH

s2.ptxt: Detach the 4 claws and 5 guides, and remove the cowl top ventilator louver RH in the direction indicated by the arrow in the illustration.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE COWL TOP VENTILATOR LOUVER LH

s2.ptxt: Detach the 6 claws and 5 guides, and remove the cowl top ventilator louver LH in the direction indicated by the arrow in the illustration.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE WINDSHIELD WIPER MOTOR AND LINK ASSEMBLY

s2.ptxt: Move the wiper cushion in the direction shown by the arrow in the illustration to detach the wiper cushion from the body, and remove the wiper motor and link.
Using a screwdriver, disconnect the 2 rods of the wiper link from the wiper motor as shown in the illustration.

atten4.ptxt: Tape the screwdriver tip before use.

s2.ptxt: Using a T30 "TORX" socket, remove the 2 bolts and wiper motor.
